entry.title: Rackspace Cloud Load Balancers Developer Guide (2014-09-11)

"CORS headers for objects""

Added a note to Section 11.1, “Create a static website” about how to disable a static website that you have created.

Fixed link for creating account users in Section 3.16.1, “Assigning Roles to Account Users”.

Added syntax requirements for specify the user name in the Add user operation.

The following additions were made to enhance Cloud Backup to enable cross-datacenter restores:

li.p: Added the BackupDataCenter parameter to the following operations in Section 3.5, “Restore configuration operations”:
As a request and response parameter to the operation to create a restore configuration
As a request parameter to the operation to update a restore configuration
Added the BackupDataCenter parameter to the following operation in Section 3.6, “Restore operations” :
As a response parameter to the operation to list details about a restore
Added the BackupId parameter to the following operations in Section 3.7, “Activity operations”:
As a response parameter to the operation to list the activity for an agent
As a response parameter to the operation to list the activity for a user

div.p: The following additions were made to enhance Cloud Backup to enable cross-datacenter restores:

As a response parameter to the operation to list details about a restore

As a response parameter to the operation to list the activity for an agent
As a response parameter to the operation to list the activity for a user

entry.title: Next Generation Cloud Servers™ Developer Guide (2014-07-24)

li.p: Added OnMetal flavors to Section 1.14, “Flavors”, including note that you can't attach block storage to OnMetal servers.

Noted that private networks won't work for OnMetal servers, noted that OnMetal servers must be created using ssh key pairs and that admin password is meaningless, and noted need to wait a few moments for network config to complete when building OnMetal servers in Section 2.1.2, “Create Server”. (I NEED EXAMPLE)
Noted that passwords are meaningless for OnMetal in Section 2.1.2.1, “Server Passwords” and Section 2.4.1, “Change Administrator Password”.

Noted that server actions are not available for OnMetal servers for following actions: Section 2.4.3, “Rebuild Server”, Section 2.4.4, “Resize Server”, Section 2.4.5, “Confirm Resized Server”, Section 2.4.1, “Change Administrator Password”, Section 2.4.6, “Revert Resized Server”, Section 2.4.7, “Rescue Server”, Section 2.4.8, “Unrescue Server”, and Section 2.4.9, “Create Image”.

li.p: Updated the table in the "Absolute limits" section of the Cloud Files Developer Guide to include the rate limit for write operations, which is 100 operations per second per container.
Updated the following object methods to include the X-Detect-Content-Type header in the request:
PUT (Create or update object)
POST (Update object metadata)
COPY (Copy object)
If you set this header to True, the Content-Type that is sent in the request (if any) is ignored, and Content-Type is guessed by using the Python mimetypes library based on the object path.

PUT (Create or update object)
POST (Update object metadata)
COPY (Copy object)
If you set this header to True, the Content-Type that is sent in the request (if any) is ignored, and Content-Type is guessed by using the Python mimetypes library based on the object path.

entry.title: Rackspace Cloud Block Storage Developer Guide (2013-08-09)

li.p: Added the update volume operation in Chapter 3, API operations .

Updated the size parameter description for the create volume operation in Chapter 3, API operations because the way creating a volume from a snapshot changed. The API for creating a volume from a snapshot was ignoring the size parameter and was creating a volume the same size as the snapshot. Now the volume size must be greater than the snapshot size.

Updated the create snapshot operation description in Chapter 3, API operations adding information about snapshot progress. The progress is visible in the os-extended-snapshot-attributes:progress field of the snapshot.
Moved the definitions of terms formally in the Concepts section to the Glossary and renamed the Concepts section to Section 1.6, “Terminology”.

Updated the size parameter description for create volume operation because the way creating a volume from a snapshot changed. Updated the create snapshot operation description adding information about snapshot progress. The progress is visible in the os-extended-snapshot-attributes:progress field of the snapshot.
Moved the definitions of terms formally in the Concepts section to the glossary and renamed the Concepts section to Terminology.
